doc.previous: XII Tactical Air Command served in combat in the Mediterranean and European theaters until May 1945. Known units were:
doc.after: Colonel Demas T. Craw was awarded the Medal of Honor for heroism during the invasion of Algeria-French Morocco (Operation Torch). When the Allies landed at Mehdia, French Morocco on 8 November 1942, he volunteered to go behind enemy lines and meet with the French commander near Port Lyautey, French Morocco, to broker a cease fire.
